isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - 10 SPEED AND 15 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON RT, RTO, AND RTX SERIES - REMOVE - LEFT REVERSE IDLER GEAR ASSEMBLY

figure.caption: Figure 68. Left Reverse Idler Gear Assembly Exploded View

step1.para: Loosen the stop nut on the idler shaft, but DO NOT REMOVE at this time ( Figure 69).

figure.caption: Figure 69. Loosen Stop Nut on Idler Shaft

step1.para: Move the mainshaft reverse gear as far to the rear as possible and remove the snap ring from the I.D. of the gear ( Figure 70).

figure.caption: Figure 70. Remove Snap Ring From I.D. of Mainshaft Reverse Gear

step1.para: Move the reverse gear forward and against the 1st speed gear, engaging the splines of the mainshaft sliding clutch ( Figure 71).
Remove the stop nut and washer from the front of the idler shaft ( Figure 72).

figure.caption: Figure 72. Remove Stop Nut and Washer From Front of Idler Shaft

step1.para: Remove the pipe plug from the rear of the idler shaft ( Figure 73).

figure.caption: Figure 73. Remove Pipe Plug From Rear of Idler Shaft

step1.para: Remove the auxiliary front countershaft bearing race ( Figure 74).

figure.caption: Figure 74. Remove Auxiliary Front Countershaft Bearing Race

step1.para: Use an impact puller, 1/2-13 threaded end, to remove the shaft from the transmission case bore ( Figure 75).

figure.caption: Figure 75. Remove Shaft From Transmission Case Bore

step1.para: As the idler shaft and the retainer washer are moved to the rear, remove the thrust washer and gear from the case ( Figure 76). If necessary, remove the inner race from the bearing bore and remove the needle bearing from the idler gear (inset).

figure.caption: Figure 76. Remove Thrust Washer and Gear From Case
